title: Kinetic Estimated Glomerular Filtration Rate (keGFR)
description: Estimates GFR in patients with acutely changing creatinine levels, allowing for earlier detection of acute kidney injury when creatinine is in a non-steady state. More accurate than traditional GFR equations during periods of rapidly changing kidney function.

parameters.name: baseline_creatinine
parameters.description: Baseline serum creatinine before acute illness (mg/dL). Use most recent stable value if available.

parameters.name: time_hours
parameters.description: Time between first and second creatinine measurements in hours

result.name: kinetic_egfr
result.description: Kinetic eGFR value with AKI risk assessment

ranges.interpretation: keGFR ≥60 mL/min/1.73 m² suggests preserved kidney function with low AKI risk
keGFR 30-59 mL/min/1.73 m² indicates moderate kidney impairment with intermediate AKI risk
keGFR 15-29 mL/min/1.73 m² indicates severe kidney impairment with high AKI risk
keGFR <15 mL/min/1.73 m² indicates kidney failure with very high AKI risk

references: Chen S. Retooling the creatinine clearance equation to estimate kinetic GFR when the plasma creatinine is changing acutely. J Am Soc Nephrol. 2013 May;24(6):877-88.
O'Sullivan ED, Doyle A. The clinical utility of kinetic glomerular filtration rate. Clin Kidney J. 2017 Apr;10(2):202-208.
Pickering JW, Ralib AM, Endre ZH. Combining creatinine and volume kinetics identifies missed cases of acute kidney injury following cardiac arrest. Crit Care. 2013 Jan 14;17(1):R7.
Dewitte A, Joannès-Boyau O, Sidobre C, Fleureau C, Bats ML, Derache P, et al. Kinetic eGFR and Novel AKI Biomarkers to Predict Renal Recovery. Clin J Am Soc Nephrol. 2015 Nov 6;10(11):1900-10.
formula: keGFR = eGFR_baseline - (Δcreatinine × Vd) / (time × BSA) where eGFR_baseline is calculated using MDRD equation, Δcreatinine = Cr2 - Cr1, Vd = distribution volume, BSA = body surface area
notes: Designed for use when creatinine is changing acutely (non-steady state)
More accurate than traditional eGFR equations during AKI
Can detect AKI 8-24 hours earlier than traditional creatinine-based criteria
keGFR <30 mL/min/1.73 m² is 90% specific for AKI (71% sensitive)
Particularly useful in ICU and post-operative settings
Requires two creatinine measurements separated by at least 1 hour
Assumes normal creatinine production rate (~20 mg/kg/day)
May be less accurate in patients with rapidly changing muscle mass
Not validated in pediatric patients or pregnancy
